item.title: Quarkus 2.0.1.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: We just released Quarkus 2.0.1.Final, our first maintenance release on top of 2.0. It is a safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.0.0.Final. If you are not using 2.0 already, please refer to the 2.0 migration guide. Full changelog You can get the full changelog of 2.0.1.Final on GitHub. Come...

item.title: Quarkus 2.0.0.Final released - Vert.x 4, MicroProfile 4, Continuous Testing and much more
item.description: The Quarkus team is proud to announce the availability of the Final release of Quarkus 2.0. This version has been a gigantic effort to bring Quarkus to a whole new level, while keeping its roots: fast boot, low memory usage and developer joy. A big thank you to everyone involved...

item.title: How Quarkus has been used to deploy applications on OpenShift
item.description: This post gives some feedback on a particular challenge I have been facing in a professional context with respect to deploying applications on Kubernetes, and how we were able to provide a solution that met our goals using Quarkus. The challenge For a few years now I have been involved...

item.title: Calling All Roadies for the Quarkus World Tour
item.description: The Quarkus World Tour kicked off in March to provide a unique, hands-on Quarkus experience for Java developers across the globe. The goal of the tour is to introduce Quarkus to Java developers and set them down the path of creating applications and participating in the community. Since the tour...

item.title: Abraxas Uses Quarkus For Cutting Edge Tax App
item.description: Two things are certain in the life of a developer: Java and Taxes. For the past 25 years, Java has been the dominant framework for developers creating enterprise applications. During that same time, developers continue to support their respective communities and countries each pay period through taxes. What do Java...

item.title: Quarkus 1.13.7.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: And here comes 1.13.7.Final, our (most probably!) last round of bugfixes for the 1.13 release. If you are not using 1.13 already, please refer to the 1.13 migration guide. Full changelog You can get the full changelog of 1.13.7.Final on GitHub. 2.0 coming soon We will soon start a new...

item.title: Quarkus 2.0.0.CR3 released - Towards Final
item.description: Thanks to your feedback, we fixed some more issues in Quarkus 2.0 and we thought a new CR was necessary. As usual, it also comes with documentation refinements. We will build the Final artifacts on June 23rd so keep the feedback coming! Migration Guide We keep the Migration Guide up...

item.title: About to release Quarkus 2 - ask us anything!
item.description: With Quarkus 2 approaching its imminent release and we passed 50 episodes of Quarkus Insights we want to do Q&A episode similar to what we did earlier in the year. We will cover the most often asked questions we have seen and any question tagged with #quarkusinsights on our various...

item.title: Quarkus 2.0.0.CR2 released - Towards Final
item.description: We just started the candidate release cycle for 2.0.0.Final. Feedback is very welcome so if you have a Quarkus app around, please give it a go. Make sure you update both the BOM version and the Quarkus Maven Plugin version to 2.0.0.CR2. Also, we only publish the quarkus-bom for non-Final...

item.title: Quarkus 1.13.6.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: Unfortunately, 1.13.5.Final introduced a regression in the Hibernate Validator extension due to a Jandex issue (Jandex is our library indexing the classes and annotations). Thus, we released 1.13.6.Final today to mitigate the issue. 1.13.6.Final is a safe upgrade for everyone using Quarkus 1.13. Please also check out the 1.13.5 announcement...
